channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Inside a Gaza hospital: A British surgeon on what he's witnessing firsthand
item.description: Dr. Nick Maynard tells NPR he's treating children shot at food distribution sites and witnessing what he believes is the systematic destruction of Gaz...

item.title: Harvard and Trump admin. face off in court. And, Texas seeks new congressional map
item.description: Harvard and the Trump administration are facing off in federal court today over the freezing of over $2 billion in grants and contracts. And, Texas la...

item.title: The world keeps millions of vaccines on ice. Is it worth it?
item.description: It costs nearly $100 million a year to maintain global stockpiles of vaccines for Ebola, cholera, meningitis and yellow fever in case of emergency. A ...

item.title: COMIC: Exploring the ocean's wonderous, mysterious depths
item.description: Did you know that we know less about the sea than we do about space? With this comic, we explore some of what scientists do know about Earth's ocean.

item.title: Texas Republicans want to redraw congressional districts in special session
item.description: Texas lawmakers begin a special session Monday. Republicans want to redraw congressional districts in order to skew voting results so the GOP wins mor...

item.title: Victims' families criticise report blaming pilot error for Jeju Air crash
item.description: The families accused investigators of pinning the blame on the pilot while ignoring other factors into the crash in South Korea.

item.title: China begins building world's largest dam, fuelling fears in India
item.description: The dam is on a Tibetan river that flows into India and Bangladesh, and could affect millions downstream.

item.title: Shark attack survivor Paul de Gelder teaches others how to stay alive if attacked
item.description: Paul de Gelder, who lost his hand and leg in a 2009 shark attack, joins "CBS Mornings" to talk about his new Discovery Channel special, "How to Surviv...

item.title: At least 19 dead after air force jet crashes into Bangladesh school
item.description: The air force says the F-7 jet experienced a mechanical fault after taking off for a training exercise in Dhaka.

item.title: Microsoft releases emergency fix for Sharepoint after cyberattacks
item.description: Microsoft issued an urgent fix after hackers used a "zero-day" exploit to infiltrate its SharePoint software.

item.title: From organ donation to innovation, 2 lives transformed by purpose
item.description: David Begnaud shares the stories of Brian Flynn, who made two living organ donations to save strangers and Rachel Bee, a teen who turned her Crohn's d...

item.title: Kenya U-turn over charging prominent activist with terror offences
item.description: The police had earlier said that Boniface Mwangi would be charged with treason, sparking a huge outcry.

item.title: Exclusive discounts from CBS Mornings Deals
item.description: On this edition of CBS Mornings Deals, we show you items that might just become essentials in your everyday life. Visit cbsdeals.com to take advantage...

item.title: Billy Porter returns to Broadway in "Cabaret at the Kit Kat Club"
item.description: Tony and Grammy winner Billy Porter joins "CBS Mornings" to talk about stepping into the role of the Emcee in Cabaret, a dream three decades in the ma...

item.title: Bangladesh plane crash: 'I heard an explosion, saw fire'
item.description: A teacher describes the moment he saw a jet crash into the school campus in the capital, Dhaka.

item.title: Suspect arrested after car crashes into post office and catches fire in San Jose, California
item.description: Authorities say a suspect was arrested after a car crashed into a post office in San Jose, California, causing the building to go up in flames.

item.title: Suspect in Los Angeles car-ramming incident has a criminal history and was on parole, police say
D-Day veteran and TikTok star ‘Papa Jake’ Larson dies at 102
